stepAnswer: The equilibrium shifts in the direction that consumes some of the added reactant.
stepTitle: According to Le Chatelier’s principle, what happens if you add more reactant to a system at equilibrium?
choices: The equilibrium shifts in the direction that consumes some of the added reactant.
The equilibrium always shifts to produce more reactant.
The equilibrium constant changes to a new value.
Nothing changes because the system is already at equilibrium.
